member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.InputMethod
member.summary: Provides the name and class ID for a member of the class for a Pocket PC. This class cannot be inherited.

member.summary: Gets a value that identifies a specific input method.
member.returns: A structure that contains a GUID that identifies a specific input method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.InputMethod.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of an input method.
member.returns: The name of the input method.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.InputMode
member.summary: Specifies the input modes that can be set on the Smartphone using an .

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.InputMode.AlphaABC
member.summary: This is the conventional method for entering text, called multi-tap, which requires up to four key presses depending on the letter being entered.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.InputMode.AlphaCurrent
member.summary: Maintains the current T9 or ABC selection for entering alpha characters as set by the user by holding down the star key (*) on a Smartphone. This mode is shared across the system so that any text box set with this mode, including text box controls in native Windows CE applications, will adhere to the last T9 or ABC choice as set by the user. This ability to match user preferences makes this the preferred input mode for text boxes that accept alpha characters.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.InputMode.AlphaT9
member.summary: This input mode is the T9 predictive text input feature on the Smartphone.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.InputMode.Numeric
member.summary: This input mode accepts only numeric characters and symbols.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.InputModeEditor
member.summary: Provides access to Smartphone input methods for entering text.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.InputModeEditor.SetInputMode(System.Windows.Forms.Control,Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.InputMode)
member.summary: Specifies the input mode on a Smartphone.
member.param: One of the values.
A control.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.LogFontPitchAndFamily
member.summary: Specifies categories of fonts.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.LogFontPitchAndFamily.Decorative
member.summary: Specifies novelty fonts. Old English is an example.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.LogFontPitchAndFamily.Default
member.summary: Specifies a default font.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.LogFontPitchAndFamily.DontCare
member.summary: Specifies that the font family is not important.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.LogFontPitchAndFamily.Fixed
member.summary: Specifies a monospaced font family.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.LogFontPitchAndFamily.Modern
member.summary: Specifies monofaced fonts with or without serifs. Pica, Elite, and Courier NewTM are examples of monospace fonts.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.LogFontPitchAndFamily.Roman
member.summary: Specifies proportional fonts with serifs. MS Serif is an example.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.LogFontPitchAndFamily.Script
member.summary: Specifies fonts designed to look like handwriting. Script and Cursive are examples.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.LogFontPitchAndFamily.Swiss
member.summary: Specifies proportional fonts without serifs. MS Sans Serif is an example.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.LogFontPitchAndFamily.Variable
member.summary: Specifies that the font family can vary.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.LogFontPrecision
member.summary: Specifies the output precision.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.LogFontPrecision.Default
member.summary: Specifies the default mapping behavior.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.LogFontPrecision.Raster
member.summary: Specifies a raster font when the system contains multiple fonts with the same name.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.LogFontPrecision.String
member.summary: Specifies raster font enumeration data.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.LogFontQuality
member.summary: Specifies the quality of a font.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.LogFontQuality.AntiAliased
member.summary: Specifies that font edges are blended to increase the smoothness of the stroke.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.LogFontQuality.ClearType
member.summary: Specifies that text is rendered using the ClearType® antialiasing method.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.LogFontQuality.ClearTypeCompat
member.summary: Specifies that the text is ClearType compatible.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.LogFontQuality.Default
member.summary: Specifies that appearance of the font does not matter.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.LogFontQuality.Draft
member.summary: Specifies that quality is less important than faster rendering.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.LogFontQuality.NonAntiAliased
member.summary: Specifies that font edges are not blended to increase the smoothness of the stroke.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.Notification.Caption
member.summary: Gets or sets a string specifying the title text for the message balloon.
member.returns: A string that specifies the caption text. The default value is an empty string ("").

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.Notification.Critical
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the notification is of urgent importance.
member.returns: true if the notification is critical; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.Notification.Icon
member.summary: Gets or sets the current icon for the message balloon on the title bar.
member.returns: An . There is no default value.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.Notification.InitialDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of seconds the message balloon remains visible after initially shown.
member.returns: The amount of time the balloon is visible, in seconds. The default is 10.
member.exception: Occurs if this property is set to a negative value.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.Notification.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text for the message balloon.
member.returns: A string containing the HTML or plain text. The default is an empty string ("").

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.Notification.Visible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the message balloon is visible.
member.returns: true if the message balloon is visible; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.ResponseSubmittedEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data for the event.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.ResponseSubmittedEventArgs.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Contains the identifier of a button or link in the message balloon, or the response from an HTML form in the message balloon.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.ResponseSubmittedEventArgs.Response
member.summary: Gets or sets a string containing the name of a selected link or button or the results of a form embedded in the text of the message balloon.
member.returns: A string value.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.ResponseSubmittedEventHandler
member.summary: Represents the method that will handle the event of a .

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.ScreenOrientation
member.summary: Specifies the angle of the orientation of the device screen that can be accessed by the property.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.ScreenOrientation.Angle0
member.summary: Specifies a portrait orientation at 0 degrees.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.ScreenOrientation.Angle180
member.summary: Specifies a landscape orientation at 180 degrees.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.ScreenOrientation.Angle270
member.summary: Specifies an orientation at 270 degrees.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.ScreenOrientation.Angle90
member.summary: Specifies an orientation at 90 degrees.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.SystemSettings
member.summary: Provides access to user interface and native Windows CE operating system settings on a device.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.SystemSettings.ScreenOrientation
member.summary: Gets or sets the current screen orientation of a device.
member.returns: One of the values, which are 0, 90, 180, and 270. The default is 0.
